answers.answer: When all else fails then try EEG Neurofeedback.  It is noninvasive and is performed by licensed professionals such as psychologists.  Neurofeedback helps calm the brain neurochemical circuitry.  It has made a world of difference in the frequency and intensity of my wife's migraines.  Many insurance plans cover the treatment and within 10-15 treatments you should notice a difference.  Keep in mind that not all solutions come in the form of a pill.Ed

I had migranes from magnesium deficiency. And I lost excess magnesium through the urine due to insulin resistance. Not a single labs showed up insulin resistance except the insulin test and my insulin levels were very high. My symptoms already told me all about insulin resistance however!I know insulin resistance is a symptom (some say a cause) of PCOS. I can suggest taking magnesium supplements. The right type of magnesium as some do not absorb well. Magnesium oxide only absorbs 4% for instance. I take magnesium chelated with amino acids.Also the LCHF (low carb high fat) diet would be worth trying out as well. Excerpts from two articles from Diet Doctor...School Refuses to Serve Food that Keeps Student Healthy..."Emil Elmqvist, 17 years old, didn’t just lose 66 lbs (30 kg) when he began eating an LCHF diet. He also lost his troublesome migraines, which is a common positive side effect of LCHF."“LCHF Helped Me Get Pregnant!”..."Isabelle Nelson is another woman who struggled in vain to get pregnant, due to the common hormonal imbalance PCOS. But after adopting a LCHF diet and losing 35 lbs in two months what so often happens happened:Just for fun, she took a pregnancy test. The test showed that she was pregnant."

I just found this info..."In the 1980s, research on the role of insulin resistance in the development of PCOS became widely known in the fertility treatment community. It appears that insulin resistance probably contributes to the development of PCOS in most women. In some of these women, insulin resistance is related to obesity and genetic factors, both of which are also linked to PCOS."I knew that was likely as PCOS was so rare in the 50's and now it's common like obesity and diabetes. I personally ate too much sugar and developed severe insulin resistance.

have you tried immetrex its a breakthrough medalso beta blockers blood medslike above the body throws fits when low on something it needseven if you have to travel far get a specialist or center for pain managementhave them run it all pee poo 100s of blood tubes also for the heck of it possibly a spine tap pain full but shows hidden problems to many to list a spin tap cold show that cause migraines and worsebasically a to z nothing left out like about specialized brain scans and those electrodes on your headit wont be over night but there has to be a answer even if it means traveling and all that fun crapgood luck

question: I'm 30 year female.  I've had a single migraine EVERYDAY for little over 6 years.   HELP!  Please :-(No doctor has been able to help with why or reduce the pain levels at all.But I don't expect much from doctors who ask me every visit about how my migraines are and how often they occur.  If they would ever read my chart, I do not have migraines, I have a single horrible migraine that has lasted 6 years.I've tried every class of migraine med there is with no relief.  No pain medicine, except IV morphine has ever even lessened pain level and it only worked for a few minutes.  The ER IV cocktail does nothing but make me tired.    The pain level does vary, but never below a 5 out of 10.  Definitely get worse when storms come in.I do have:-Normal MRI/CT-Normal opening pressure on spinal tap-PCOSI do not have:-Ringing in ear-Auras-High blood pressure-High CSF pressure-PTSD-Allergies except to latex and penicillin (and other 'cillins)-Never been in car accident-No known triggers and have tried elimination diets with no effects.-Diabetes-Or any other diagnosed disease.I've Also tried multiple chiropractors, acupuncturists, massage, aromatherapy.  I get relaxed with some, but pain level doesn't get better.
title: Neverending Migraine for 6 years
